Race.SpecificTitle: District Judge -- 24th JDC, Elec. Sec. 2, Div. A
Councilmen at Large -- City of DeRidder
Calcasieu-Cameron Hosp. Serv. Dist. --  6.95 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Calcasieu-Cameron Hospital Service District Proposition

Summary:  10 year, 6.95 mills property tax for improving, maintaining, operating and supporting the hospital facilities of the Hospital Service District, including the acquisition of equipment and maintaining, expanding the District's Emergency Department capabilities and supporting Therapeutic Riding and the District's Rural Health Clinics in Vinton and Hackberry.
Race.FullText: Shall Calcasieu-Cameron Hospital Service District, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a six and ninety-five hundredths (6.95) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $5,000,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2010 and ending with the year 2019, for the purpose of improving, maintaining, operating and supporting the hospital facilities of the Hospital Service District, including the acquisition of equipment and maintaining, expanding the District's Emergency Department capabilities and supporting Therapeutic Riding and the District's Rural Health Clinics in Vinton and Hackberry?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Teche-VRML Fresh Water Dist. -- 1.5 Mills (Renewal) - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Teche-Vermilion Fresh Water District Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10 year 1.5 mills property tax renewal for constructing, establishing, extending, maintaining, operating and protecting a fresh water supply and abating pollution in Bayou Teche and the Vermilion River within the District, title to which public works shall be in the public.
Race.FullText: Shall the Teche-Vermilion Fresh Water District of the State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a one and one-half (1.5) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within said District (an estimated $3,667,400 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020, for the purpose of constructing, establishing, extending, maintaining, operating and protecting a fresh water supply and abating pollution in Bayou Teche and the Vermilion River within the said District, title to which public works shall be in the public?
